sentence.idiomatic: He is China's most famous movie star.
Is he the America's most famous teacher? Yes.
He isn't the most famous person here.
He is a movie star.
Is Ms. Li a TV star? Yes.
Mr. Wang doesn't know that sports star.
Is Bruce Lee a movie star? Of course he is.
Do you know Ms. Li? Of course I do.
Of course he doesn't know me, we've never met before.
He is a kung fu movie master.
He's not a master chef.
Is she a dance master? No, she's a master of film.
romance movie
war movie
documentary
He became a world superstar in Hollywood.
I didn't become a TV star in Hong Kong.
Did you become a teacher in England? Yes.
Bruce Lee is a World Superstar.
Is Mr. Wang a TV superstar? No, he's a movie superstar.
Ms. Li is not a dance superstar.
Bruce Lee's trademark is the nunchuk.
Is that restaurant's signature dish is steak? Yes.
What is that club's trademark show?
His yell is really loud.
Ms. Li's singing voice is very nice.
Is Mr. Wang's speaking voice pleasant? Very pleasant.

Who is China’s most famous movie star? Of course it’s Bruce Lee, or Li Xiaolong. He's a native of Hong Kong. He's a master of kung fu movies. He became a world superstar in Hollywood. His trademark was his nunchuk and his yell.
